Class Truck

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      gameFiles.Truck
All Implemented Interfaces:
MapElement, java.lang.Runnable
public class Truck
extends java.lang.Thread
implements MapElement

Nested Class Summary
static class Truck.Status
          The Two States that a Truck can be in at any time - either Waiting (staying on its location and awaiting further travel instructions) or Traveling (currently moving from node to node according to its travel instructions).
 
Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread
java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

setTruckName

public void setTruckName(java.lang.String newName)
Sets the name of this Truck, and the Thread

getLocation

public Node getLocation()
Returns the Truck's current location. If this.status.equals(Status.TRAVELING), returns null

getTravelingTo

public Node getTravelingTo()
Returns the Truck's current destination. If this.status.equals(Status.WAITING), returns null

getGoingTo

public Node getGoingTo()
Returns the Truck's eventual destination; the Node this Truck will be at when the current travel queue is empty. If this.status.equals(Status.WAITING), returns null

getStatus

public Truck.Status getStatus()
Returns the current status of this Truck, either TRAVELING or WAITING

setStatus

public void setStatus(Truck.Status s)
Sets the current status of this Truck to status s and fires a Manager Notification. Does not fire a Manager Notification if status.equals(s)

getLoad

public Parcel getLoad()
Returns the parcel this Truck is carrying. Returns null if no truck is being carried

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor()
Returns the Color of this Truck

Specified by:
getColor in interface MapElement

loadUnloadParcel

public void loadUnloadParcel(Parcel p,
                             boolean state)
Handles loading and unloading parcels in a synchronized fashion to avoid thread collision.

Parameters:
p - - The parcel to pick up or drop off
state - - either Truck.LOAD or Truck.UNLOAD

addToTravel

public void addToTravel(Edge r)
Adds the road r to this Truck's travel plans, in a fashion that prevents thread collision

clearTravel

public void clearTravel()
Clears the Truck's travel plans, in a fashion that prevents thread collision. Resets goingTo (The Node the Truck will eventually end up at) to the value of the travelingTo field (The Node the Truck is currently traveling towards)
